verse.name: v1
verse.lines: In a shady nook one moonlight night A leprechaun I spied, With scarlet cap and coat of green; A cruiskenn by his side. 'Twas a tick tack tick, his hammer went, Upon a tiny shoe, And I laughed to think of a purse of gold; But the fairy was laughing too!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: With a tip toe step and beating heart, Quite softly I drew nigh: There was mischief in his merry face; A twinkle in his eye. He hammered and sang with tiny voice, And drank his mountain dew; And I laughed to think he was caught at last: But the fairy was laughing too!

verse.name: v3
